messages.title: STABILITY FOR BREXIT AND BEYOND
messages.content: Prime Minister Theresa May asks country for support to strengthen hand in Brexit negotiations and to lock in Britain’s economic progress.

messages.title: LET'S GET ON WITH THE JOB: WHY EVERY VOTE WILL COUNT
messages.content: It is cast for me and my team of Conservatives will vote for strong and stable leadership to see us through and beyond Brexit.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Stability for Brexit and beyond - Strengthening Britain's hand in Brexit negotiations.
Locking in economic progress for the future.
Taking back control of our borders, our laws and our money.

issues.economy: Locking in our economic progress so it can benefit the British people for the future
issues.education: A good school place for every child
issues.health: A strong economy paying for a strong NHS
issues.immigration: Take back control of our borders
issues.lawCrime: Take back control of our laws and our money

community.content: Provide as much certainty as possible at every stage of the process.

leaflet.personalStatement: The only way you can ensure we have the strong and stable leadership to get this right is by backing me and voting for my Conservative candidate in your local area.

contactInformation.address: Promoted by Sir Patrick McLoughlin on behalf of the Conservative Party, both at 4 Matthew Parker Street, London, SW1H 9HQ.

quotes.text: Every vote that is cast for me and my team of Conservatives will vote for strong and stable leadership to see us through and beyond Brexit.

images.caption: Theresa May and supporters with 'Strong and Stable Leadership'

examples: Accused of plotting to make Jeremy Corbyn PM in return for IndyRef2 (telegraph.co.uk 20th April 2017)
Labour plots Brexit deal with other parties if Tories don't win election majority (Mirror, 20th April 2017)
In stunning upset, billionaire candidate scores shock White House victory (BBC, 5th November 2016)
A good school place for every child
A strong economy paying for a strong NHS
Provide as much certainty as possible at every stage of the process
Take back control of our borders
Take back control of our laws and our money
Sign new trade deals around the world with new friends and old partners

personalStories.story: Theresa May explaining why a vote is being held in five years.

examples: Labour plots Brexit deal with other parties if Tories don't win election majority
Labour, the Lib Dems and the SNP disrupting Brexit negotiation.
A coalition of chaos with Jeremy Corbyn
